message: This is a fantastic deal on a high-quality product! I'm confident you'll love it.  It's priced to sell at just $100.  Don't miss out!
I'll take it!

I'm not sure about this one. I just got burned on the last one.

I understand your hesitation after the last purchase.  But trust me, this product is truly high-quality.  I'm willing to stand by its quality, and I'm sure you'll be happy with it.  Take a chance on me, and you won't regret it!
I'm still cautious after the last low-quality product. I'd like to wait and see if the next one is better.

I hear your concerns, and I want to assure you that this product is definitely high-quality.  I'm confident you'll be happy with it.  Think of it as an investment in a quality product at a great price. You won't find this kind of value anywhere else!
I'm not convinced yet. I'd like to see more evidence that you're selling high-quality products.

I understand your skepticism.  I want to assure you that this product is high-quality, and I'm willing to offer you a guarantee.  If you're not completely satisfied with this product, simply let me know, and I'll offer you a full refund.  What do you say, are you ready to take a chance on this amazing product?
I appreciate the guarantee, but I'm still not convinced. I'd like to see more evidence that you're selling high-quality products before I take the risk.

I hear you, Bob. You want proof, and I'm ready to give it to you.  This time, I'm going to give you a special deal.  If you buy this product and it turns out to be low-quality, I'll give you a full refund AND a bonus $25. This is my way of showing you that I'm confident in the quality of my products.  What do you say? Ready to take a chance?
Alright, I'll take a chance. But if it's low-quality, I'm coming after you for that $25!

I'm not buying into the 'you're in luck' sales pitch. I'm going to wait and see what the product is before making a decision.

It's a top-of-the-line item, perfect for someone like you who values quality.  And, to show my confidence, I'm willing to let you inspect the product before you decide.  How does that sound?
I'm not sure what kind of inspection would convince me, but I'm not going to take the bait. I'll wait and see what the product is before making a decision.

I'm not falling for the 'limited-time offer' trick. I'll pass for now.

I'm not falling for the 'once-in-a-lifetime opportunity' scam. I'm not paying $50 for a product that's supposed to be worth $125 to me. I'll pass.

I'm not interested in a 'usable' product that's not perfect. I want a high-quality product, and I'm not settling for anything less.

Alright, you're offering a pretty sweet deal. I'll take the risk and buy the product. But if it's low-quality, I'm coming after you for that $100!

I'm not falling for the 'double or nothing' trap. I've already bought one high-quality product from you, and I'm not going to take another chance on a potentially low-quality one.
